com.versant.trans
Interface VEnumeration

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Enumeration
public interface VEnumeration
extends java.util.Enumeration

The VEnumeration Interface provides methods to manage a sequence of persistent objects that would be returned by a query. It is used for the result of a TransSession.select(Class, com.versant.fund.Predicate) or for a result of VQL query, both with and without a cursor.

See Also:
Enumeration, Handle

Handle nextHandle()
Deprecated. This method is similar to nextElement() on java.util.Enumeration, but it returns the result as a com.versant.fund.Handle. this method throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if there are no more objects in the VEnumeration to iterate over.

nextBatch

java.lang.Object[] nextBatch()
Deprecated. Return the next batch of objects. The batch of objects returned will be read from all connected databases using group read. The batch size used is 100. The default lockmode is used to group read the objects.

Returns:
a persistent object array that contains the next batch of results.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are no more batch of objects can be fetched from the VEnumeration.
See Also:
VEnumeration.nextBatch(int,int,int)

nextBatch

java.lang.Object[] nextBatch(int batchSize)
Return the next batch of objects. The batch of objects returned will be group read. The scope of the group read includes all connected databases. The group read is done in the same session that was used to perform the query. The objects will be read in with the default lockmode. If the session in which the query was done is different from the session of the current thread an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
batchSize - The batch size to be retrieved from database.
Returns:
a persistent object array that contains the next batch of results.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are no more batch of objects can be fetched from the VEnumeration.
See Also:
VEnumeration.nextBatch(int,int,int)

nextBatch

java.lang.Object[] nextBatch(int batchSize,
                             int options,
                             int lockmode)
Return the next batch of objects. The batch of objects returned will be read from all connected databases using group read in the same session. If the session in which the query was done is different from the session of the current thread an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
batchSize - the batch size to be retrieved from database
options - options for group read.
lockmode - lock to be placed on the objects.
Returns:
a persistent object array that contains the next batch of results.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are no more batch of objects that can be fetched from the VEnumeration.
See Also:
TransSession.groupReadObjects(Object[],String,int,int)

size

int size()
Returns the number of objects in this enumeration.

For cursor based queries, this method returns the current cursor batch size.

invalidateCursor

void invalidateCursor()
Invalidates a database cursor obtained by a cursor based query. Once invalidated, no more fetches can be performed on the cursor.

When you finish using a cursor you must invalidate it to release it. This can be done by invoking the invalidateCursor () method on the VEnumeration instance being used to iterate through the cursor. All open cursors are automatically released at the end of each transaction.

This method does nothing for a VEnumeration which is not the result of a cursor query.

See Also:
VQLQuery.executeWithCursor(int)
